description: Golf at the Angus Glen Golf Club offers beauty, challenge, first-class service and maybe best of all, variety. Angus Glen Golf Club is a public golf course and is known internationally for hosting PGA Tour events on both of its championship golf courses. Each time you choose to play Angus Glen, you are walking the same fairways that the world’s best golfers have competed on. The South Course hosted the 2002 Canadian Open, when John Rollins defeated Justin Leonard and Neal Lancaster in an exciting sudden death playoff. Capturing the title for the second consecutive year Jim Furyk out duelled Vijay Singh on the North Course to win the 2007 Canadian Open.

reviews.title: Bad exprience
text: I was hosting a group of friends  but was so embarrassing,
The braised lamp shank, asked for medium well, i got a medium rare instead, couldn't finish it, and the meat pc was so chunky and big
Ordered Salads to have it as appetizer, after long waiting we were told it leaves kitchen all together with food,( when server didn’t say that when ordered )
My friend asked for lemon & mint juice, got WATER with lemon & mint instead
2 other friends ordered mash potato to be served with their Atlantic Salmon, never served, till later when they figured out it was forgotten by the server
Another forgotten order of Salad ( Artisan green )
Tea pots of hot water, we’ve been told it’s enough for 2 mugs but it actually filled only one mug
Very bad service today, clearly a poor training for the new staff
as I’m a regular customer & never been like this 😌

reviews.title: Disappointing conditions
text: Played Angus Glen at a "special" rate of $140. Too expensive for the conditions. Fairways had a lot of bald spots and were often hard as a rock. The greens all looked like they had a fungus and one green was so littered with goose poop you couldn't putt directly at the pin because the ball would stop or change direction. Gross.
There are so many other nice courses for better $ value.

reviews.title: Over 5 hour round and the course is pretty beat up for the price
text: I played the South course recently for a Friday round. The course, in my opinion, has seen better days. The fairways, greens and tee boxes were all pretty beat up. We flew through the first 9 holes, and I was thinking we'd be a 4 hour round. Unfortunately, we quickly caught up to the group ahead of us by Hole 11, and it got slow from there on. We didn't see the course Marshall the entire round, so there was no one to speed up play. It was well over 5 hours by the time we were finished.
For the price, I expect the course to be in better condition and the management to make some effort to ensure the rounds are completed within 4.5 hours.

reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed
text: I am a bit of a duffer. I have been looking forward to golfing at Angus Glen for a few years. Regular rack rate is quite steep compared to most courses I play. I thought this track would be a very up-end experience.
Tee blocks were chewed-up. More than a few of the sand traps had a thin layer of packed sand.
This next point maybe very picky, but I think it is indicative of the entire course.

When I first arrived, there no soap in 2 soap dispenser the the men's washroom. After the game, 4 hours plus later, there was no soap in any of the dispensers. The cours and club house need more attention.
Thankfully I played with a discount coupon. There are a number of better  value courses around the GTA.
Angus Glen......Been there, done that.

reviews.title: North Course
text: Overpriced for condition of North course. Too many ball marks on greens, sand traps inconsistent with some very nice and soft sand,  many unraked  (morning round this is not acceptable) and many sand traps hard as concrete. Doubt will play this again at this price.

reviews.title: Good golf course but a bit expensive
text: This course had been the site for PGA, Skin game and many tournaments. It is not an easy course with high rough and deep bunkers which is almost a one stroke penalty when you drove into them. The club house is very good and the service is admirable. The driving range is also well kept and the staff pays good attention to serve all the players. It is free so one can warm up well before tee off. Green fee is not cheap and above $150 but for this price, think it is a bit overpriced. One may be able to get a lower rate via "Golfnow" website or sometimes there may be coupons (from Underpar.com or southernontariogolfer.com) available at a substantial discount off the regular price. But if you are a visitor, you better check before coming in town and plan your schedule ahead to enjoy the discount.

reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
text: This was my 4th time playing Angus Glen.  This time I played the North course.  All I can say is the course was in very good condition especially over other water logged courses in the area.
The fairways were perfect, the greens had some dark spots (not sure what it was) but were fast as I 3 putted many greens.
Will definitely be back

reviews.title: Golf tournament
text: Have been going to this course for many years.  The course is breathtaking.  Food and staff are very is excellent.  Great place to spend the day.

reviews.title: Golf...or Dine...or Hold a Special Event...Look no further!
text: I have golfed at this great site, with multiple courses.  We have attended several events at this location from Weddings to Fund Raisers.  It is that adaptable and does each function to the height of expectation.

reviews.title: Don't miss the South Course - One of the best in the GTA !!!
text: Played the South course at Angus Glen this week and couldnt have been more pleased.  Got around 18 holes in 3 hours 45 minutes with no waiting to speak of. The track was in excellent condition for early November in Southern Ontario (!) and the staff,starters, marshall, pro shop, beverage cart and restaurant staff really made it an exceptional experience - thank you to you all!

This is an excellent test of golf - try it from the Blue tees to give it a real test. Perfect fairways ( with one tiny exception) flat tees, good sandy bunkers, fair rough and great greens made for a superb day.
One little request....please REPAIR YOUR BALL MARKS ON THE GREENS -  this is too nice of a course for anyone to abuse in that way.

reviews.title: Wedding at Angus Glen
text: We had a beautiful wedding at Angus Glen on August 2, 2014.  From when we first viewed the venue to our wedding night, the experience was absolutely wonderful.

We worked with a fabulous wedding coordinator, Christy Field, who was a total lifesaver and made our day run flawlessly.  She was so positive and fun and handled all of our questions quickly and thoroughly.  I got the sense that she really cared about us and our day and I trusted her opinions and suggestions.  She provided a structure to keep us organized and made sure everything was ready well ahead of time.  On the night of the rehearsal, she organized everyone and carried out everything I wanted, leaving me to enjoy the night stress-free.  The day of the wedding went so smoothly.  When I arrived everything was perfect and I could truly enjoy the experience.  I’m sure she worked so hard behind the scenes to make it all run smoothly.  THANK YOU Christy!!!

The venue at Angus Glen is outstanding.  We got married in the Marquee and it looked amazing with the clean white walls and garden views.  Our pictures look so beautiful.  One of my favourite parts was escaping with my husband and photographers on a golf cart to take pictures around the grounds.  Angus Glen staff accompanied us with hors d’oeuvres and beer!  It was a fun and relaxing time between my new husband and I that I am so thankful for.

The Great Hall was very large and spacious.  It looked fabulous when all decorated.  The meal was excellent and so many of our guests commented to us on how it was the best wedding food they’ve ever had.  We had a choice of steak, salmon, and chicken.  They were all delicious but we got the most comments on how the steak was “restaurant quality.”
Thank you Angus Glen for making our wedding day fun, easy, and beautiful!

reviews.title: One of Canada's Best!
text: I was here back in May for a Golf Conference and the Angus Glen team and staff was outstanding. We were lucky and got to play the course twice; what a great track. It's easy to understand how and why they hosted 2 RBC Canadian Opens. The clubhouse itself is amazing, the food was outstanding. The range and practice facility was also first class. The whole experience at Angus Glen was remarkable. I will be back any chance I can get out that way. The location of the course is also very easy and accessible.

reviews.title: A tough winter
text: I played in a tournament at Angus Glen and was extremely disappointed in the shape of the greens.  As I was a guest I didn't pay for the round but online they charge $180 which in my opinion is way to much for a course in that shape.

reviews.title: Restaurant review only.
text: We had lunch at The Silo Grill Restaurant, mid-week. Despite the fact that we were alone in the restaurant at noon, we were left sitting at the table while the bartender/server chatted with someone at the bar.
The sandwiches were mediocre, and expensive. We also had to wait a long time for the check because the server had vanished.
Perhaps it suits patrons if they're golfing, or just want a drink.
One of the worst places we've eaten at.

reviews.title: Best Golf Course in the GTA
text: Angus Glen is the best golf course in the GTA.   There are 2 18 courses to play that are very long and very challenging to play.  It is the most beautiful country setting at any time of the year.  The staff are friendly and helpful.  Angus Glen is also a great venue for lunch and dinner.

reviews.title: Great Location For A Function
text: Whatever size function that you have planned , this is a good venue. Staff are knowledgeable and professional .
Price is somewhat high , but good value , regardless.
It's a long cold walk from the parking lot to the front door in winter , however.

reviews.title: Amazing course
text: I have played this course in tournaments only, and it is always an amazing experience. However, you need to be somewhat of a golfer to even try this course. It can get challenging even for the experienced golfer.

reviews.title: Good close by club
text: don't have to travel far, with boundary of GTA.  Good greens and good for all levels.  Great club house. Rather expensive if you have to rent.  Good designs and environment.

reviews.title: Goprgeous Links Course
text: It has 2X18 holes but the South course is better. Their Bar and F& B is very good too. Have played there many times and have found it to be always good value.

reviews.title: Angus Glen first timer
text: This is a top-notch facility - from the staff greeting you in the parking lot, to the immaculate pro shop and best of all to the course itself.  Magnificent.  We played the North course and it was perfectly groomed, fairway grass was amazing, greens were fast but fair.  We weren't crowded and did not push anyone.
A fabulous golf day, topped off by a great meal inte restaurant.
Amazing!

reviews.title: Just Wonderful!
text: I am not a golfer but found myself here for an evening event.... wow!  A gigantic piece of paradise just on the edge of chaos.  A long winding driveway leads to a wonderful club house.  The staff were very attentive, the food fantastic and the entertainment top notch.

reviews.title: Great Dinner and Venue
text: I visited Angus Glen for a seminar, and while I did not tee-off, the grounds were beautiful.
Great venue for business meetinga etc.
Dinner was delicious.

reviews.title: Great Day Out/Night Out
text: Visited Angus Glen twice on my visit to Toronto, the first time was for dinner which was tremendous and the portion sizes were great.  Bar/waiting staff were very accommodating and attentive.

Second time I was there I played the North course with was a good level, this isn't the course that the Canadian Open was held on.  The degree of difficulty was good for a 12 handicapper and I thoroughly enjoyed my round.  The buggies with GPS are an absolute god send though as it is quite a walk between holes if you had to walk.
Once again lunch was great and good to get out of the sun for a bit before heading back out to play the South course.

The South course is where the Canadian Open was held a few years back and it is difficult.  Carry to the fairways is quite a long way and the fairways are quite tight, you really need to be accurate and any sort of erratic drives from the tee will find you in trouble.
Markham is only about 50 minutes from Downtown Toronto and is definitely worth a visit if you want to get out to the countryside for a bit and get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
All in all a great place to visit.

reviews.title: Nice course with a good clubhouse
text: Beautiful course, nice layout. Medium degree of difficulty. Good facilities in the clubhouse. banquet dinner was above average. Not far from downtown yet it feels like its out in the country.

reviews.title: Not impressed!
text: I played a tournament there a few days ago on the North course. Absolutely horrible bunkers. My par 64 local course is better than this. Can't believe how much they charge and can't believe they are hosts to the PanAm Games. I emailed the staff a few days ago to ask why they are in this condition and no one has responded yet.

reviews.title: Great looking course and helpful staff
text: Had a chance to visit this location and was very impressed by it all. The club house is well kept and looks great looking down over the course. Staff very helpful.

reviews.title: Excellent Service
text: I have played here several times with my own group and also as part of an event. This is a very nice golf course with a beautiful club house. if you ever want to hold your own golf event, they really take care of you. i organized my own little corporate event and though it was a small event for them. they took care of every single detail.

reviews.title: Great alternative to the average restaurant
text: We often visit Angus Glen for Sunday Brunch or dinner. The food is excellent and it's always nice to  be able to enjoy the beautiful setting. When an event or tournament is going on it can sometimes be noisy inside. During the nice weather the patio is a quieter alternative.

reviews.title: World Class Golf Course
text: AG is a world class golf course.  There are 2 courses, both very challenging and fun.  Great food and staff compliments this venue.

reviews.title: Wedding
text: Had a great day at the Angus glen golf club wedding was outside on the terrace weather was fab, moved  inside after service. Staff were great meal was good and buffet later was fab. Husband also played two rounds of golf and said it is a great course.

reviews.title: Putting on Broccoli!!!
text: What's not to like?  Gorgeous piece of real estate made into two incredible tracks.  Sure it even play host to the Canadian Open a few times.  Oh...why not a 5?  They aerated the greens so horribly that it was like putting on broccoli!!!!  You know, my game is challenged enough.  There are trees, sands, water, waterfowls, thickets, roughs, narrow fairways, blind shots, short layups, and dogs legs...isn't that enough to want to stab yourself with a long iron?  To top is all off, we were playing behind an obnoxious group of ID-TEN-Ts (or idiots for some of you who don't type politically correct!  LOL!)

For the money that you pay for the privilege of playing one of their tracks, they could at least advise you that the North course is not in the best of shape.  Give me a break on the fees or at least let me have a chance to choose the south course.
All the whining aside, the track itself was great.  The fall tree lines were something to enjoy and the sunny day out in "MID October!" was incredible!
Bonus is that the water levels dropped considerably and since there was slow play, I took the opportunity to get grab a few of my golf ball donations back!  Nice Haul!

reviews.title: Angus Glen is not worth it
text: We booked the North Course several weeks in advance.  18 guys traveling 3+ hours to play over the weekend.  We were not told of the terrible (embarrassing) conditions the North Course was in.  Not in advance and not the day of the event.  We were shocked that no one said anything in the Pro Shop as they took our $150 that the course was entirely unplayable.  From tee to green...absolutely the worst golf experience of my life.

We're not unreasonable guys and we're not "golf snobs".  We understand it was a drought year and many courses have taken a hit.  It is the deception that is the issue.  The North course is a joke.  They should have either been honest and offered a discount, offered to accommodate us on the south course, or at least tell us the truth and let us make an informed decision.  It's insulting really.  We would have gladly paid the premium to be on the south course to have a proper golf experience.

To their credit, AFTER we complained, the course offered to accommodate the whole group at no charge on another trip to the south course.  Personally, I'm not interested.  I can play a lot of other courses and even pay more money and be GUARANTEED a proper golf experience.  The lack of transparency has left a bad taste for our group.

Save your money...or better yet, drive about 35 minutes north to Wooden Sticks in Uxbridge and for $50 more, your group will be treated like KINGS.  We were there the day before and WILL be going back for a stay and play package.  Not only that, the staff there went out of there way to cater to our group.  It was NIGHT AND DAY different.

reviews.title: Not as good as the last time
text: My wife and I played here today as business guests. The course is interesting and challenging enough. The greens are very soft which causes balls to make huge ball marks many of which are unrepaired or poorly repaired. The greens also had blotches we could not identify. There was no on-course Marshall to speed up the slow group in front of us. The carts do not have towels. The only available drinking water is that purchased from concessions. This used to be a week-kept high end daily fee golf course. Those days are gone and the impression given is that it is being run for cash only.

reviews.title: South Course - should be in better shape
text: The weekday rate to play the South Course is a pricey $180 (deals can be found).  At this price you expect great service, great facilities and a memorable golfing experience.  Sadly, Angus Glen failed to live up to their hype on most levels.  The clubhouse is beginning to look tired, the service was decent but far from outstanding and the course in rougher shape than it should have been.  I found the greens slow, many grass areas thinned out and the bunkers in rough shape.  Angus Glen seems to be living off of the fact they twice hosted the Canadian Open together with the Pan Am Games.  Frankly, there aren't many memorable holes and for the price point you'll find way better public courses in the Greater Toronto Area.

reviews.title: Very nice golf experience!
text: I played the 18 holes at the south course. The weather was very nice, mix of sunny and cloudy with a little breeze. I played with my colleagues and had an excellent experience.

reviews.title: Wedding Venue
text: Beautiful venue.  We attended a wedding this passed weekend.  Amazing grounds.  We spent the afternoon and evening on the large deck over looking the course.  Service from all staff we encountered was top shelf.

reviews.title: Don't waste your money
text: The good: course layout (north course).

The bad: conditions of the course were terrible, fairways not wartered, the bunkers had no sand and no rakes, weeds growing in the bunkers,the greens were in bad shape, fungus patches on most of the greens.
Do not spend your money on this golf course, $160.00 during the week is way too much with the condition it is in.

reviews.title: Excellent Golf Club
text: My second visit here [after 2 years] and this only confirmed my initial impression of a good golf course.
A good golf course for all levels of player - although some of the water carry's would be daunting for a beginner.
Wide fairways - but trouble is never far away.
Undulating fairways, many changes in elevation,  fast greens, frequent water, mature trees, and good variety of hole layouts..
Course is in good condition and there is excellent separation between green and tee holes and individual fairways.
If you want to walk then make sure you have the stamina;  long walks between some of the holes and many long or sharp inclines.
No marshalling of groups evident - 4 1/2 hour + round.
Pleasant bar and indoor Patio.
Tip: Leave clubs at bag drop while you are with the car - a long walk to the pro shop from the parking lot
Tip/comment: No drinkable  water on the  course or at the halfway house.

reviews.title: Great facility, beautiful course, awesome experience
text: Recently played the north course, love the forgiving fairways and manicured and sculpted layout.   Course is in great shape, still a challenge for the average golfer, with the greens being very fast.   I love this course, we had a great day, fine meal afterwards on the patio...just a great golfing experience overall.

reviews.title: Wonderful venue to attend events. An oasis in Markham.
text: We recently attended a fund raiser for the Jennifer Ashley Foundation at the Glen. It is a oasis, almost surrounded by urban sprawl. The grounds are beautifully manicured, with greens that make me want to take up golfing.

It is our second time there. The venue itself was in a large, nicely appointed, comfortable room that was far more atmospheric then a generic ball room at a hotel or conference centre. Food was flavourful. Looking forward to going back next year.
